isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 1.8: DIAGNOSTIC SOFTWARE SELF TEST OPERATION - OPERATOR ON DEMAND TESTS - TEST PROCEDURE

step1.para: Select "Engine Running Test" from the "Diagnostic Test" menu in the EST and press "ENTER" to begin the test.

The ECM will begin to raise the engine idle speed to a pre-determined value. It will then command the IPR valve to set the injection control pressure to rated speed pressure. If the performance of the IPR is acceptable, the ECM will control the IPR valve to reduce the pressure in steps while continuing to monitor the performance of the injection control pressure system.

note.para: To perform this test, the following conditions should be present:

step1.para: ENGINE COOLANT TEMPERATURE MUST BE AT LEAST 160° F.

para.emph: BATTERY VOLTAGE MUST BE HIGHER THAN 12.5 VOLTS.
NO VEHICLE SPEED SENSOR (VSS) SIGNAL SHOULD BE PRESENT.
IF ACTIVE FAULT CODES ARE PRESENT, THEY MUST BE REPAIRED AND CLEARED PRIOR TO RUNNING THIS TEST.

step1.para: After the test is completed, normal engine operation is restored by the ECM and fault codes will be transmitted as previously described.
